abstract: The co-founders of Big D Screen Printing split up when they couldn’t agree on what size customer to pursue.
snippet: The co-founders of Big D Screen Printing split up when they couldn’t agree on what size customer to pursue.
lead_paragraph: We just published a case study that explores whether Big D Custom Screen Printing can become profitable by taking small orders — even ones for a single T-shirt.

headline.main: Can You Make Money on Small Customers?

abstract: Two partners split over their company’s path to profitability.
snippet: Two partners split over their company’s path to profitability.
lead_paragraph: Darren Robbins and a partner founded Big D Custom Screen Printing in 2007. In its first year, the company, which is based in Austin, Tex., and specializes in printing T-shirts, recorded sales of $325,000 and a small loss.

headline.main: Can Chasing Small Customers Lead to Larger Profits?
headline.print_headline: Can Chasing Small Customers Lead to Larger Profits?

abstract: Looking at the highfliers in the Galleon insider trading case, William D. Cohan, a contributor to the New York Times, examines why people who seem to have it all want to threaten their wealth, prestige and top jobs with risky behavior. Is it really just that they think they can get away with it?
snippet: Looking at the highfliers in the Galleon insider trading case, William D. Cohan, a contributor to the New York Times, examines why people who seem to have it all want to threaten their wealth, prestige and top jobs with risky behavior. Is it reall...
lead_paragraph: Looking at the highfliers in the Galleon insider trading case, William D. Cohan, a contributor to the New York Times’ Opinion section, examines why people who seem to have it all want to threaten their wealth, prestige and top jobs with risky behavior. Is it really just that they think they can get away with it? Read more »
